Headline: Mid-Afternoon Market Update: Dow Tumbles Over 300 Points; Federal Reserve Maintains Interest Rates

Headline: Fed Maintains Interest Rates, Continues Asset Purchases, Forecasts 2023 Rate Hike
Content: The Federal Reserve maintained its target fed funds rate range of between zero and 0.25%. The Fed also reassured investors it will continue to support the economy via asset purchases while the U.S. recovers from the pandemic.

Headline: May Retail Sales Supportive Of Freight Flows

Headline: Unemployment Rate Reaches Lowest Level Of Pandemic: What You Need To Know
Content:
Employment rose by almost 950,000 jobs in July and the unemployment rate dropped by 0.5%, according to Friday's Bureau of Labor Statistics report.

That leaves the unemployment rate at 5.4%, the lowest it's been since the pandemic began in America in March 2020.
